data.description: Firefox Reality brings content from the web that you know and love to Virtual Reality headsets. Our browser provides an open, accessible and secure way for everyone to explore the web. Experience sharp text, high quality videos, and a seamless transition from 2D to 3D immersive modes. Now with multiple windows, tabs and Firefox Accounts integration, you can enjoy the best possible web browsing experience with Firefox Reality.

changelog.change_log:
Add-ons support. This release adds support for: uBlock, Dark Reader, HTTPS Everywhere, Privacy Badger, NoScript Security and Privacy Possum.

Auto-fill support. Now you will be prompted to auto-fill. Auto-fill is also synced with your FxA account in case it's connected. 

The Library panel has been redesigned. 

The tray now contains information about time, battery and WiFi status. 

Bug fixes and performance improvements.

Security fix. See https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2020-03/ for details.



With this fix, Autoplay functionality will temporarily be disabled.

*Send tabs into VR from your computer or mobile phone when you sign in with your Firefox Account.
*Sync your bookmarks and history across devices when you're signed in.
*Copy and paste: one of our most-requested features! Long-press on text to access the copy and paste menu.
*New languages and keyboards - Swedish, Dutch, Finnish, Danish, Norwegian, and Polish.
*Support for Bluetooth keyboards (where these are supported by the device).
*New control over popup blocking.

Lots of bug fixes! This release doesn't have any new features, but it has improvements to many of our current ones. Look for a more polished interface, better localized text and more overall stability.

• Multi-window browsing- Open additional windows, arrange and resize them for a new way to experience the web in VR.
• Local browser history- Get back to sites you've visited before without typing. See your visited sites in the search bar. Clear your history or turn if off anytime from settings.
• Movable keyboard, so you can place it where it’s most comfortable to type.
• Tooltips on buttons and actions throughout the app.
• Updated look and feel for the Bookmarks and History views so you can see and interact better at all window sizes.
• An easy way to request the desktop version of a site that doesn’t display well in VR, right from the search bar.
• Updated and reorganized settings to be easier to find and understand.
• Added the ability to set a preferred website language order.
Support for 6DoF controllers, new environments, option for curved browser window, greatly improved YouTube support, and many bug fixes.
